CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 1, 1958, p. 1, reads: "Proud of his Dad - Robert King, age 9, being held by his father, Detective John Henry King, who was sworn in as a city detective, third grade, merit promotion classification, last Friday, shakes hands with Director of Public Safety Louis Rosenberg. Left to right are Mr. King's children, Queen Esther, 13; John Jr., 16, and William, 11, standing in front of the younger John King; Detective King, Robert, Mrs. King, and on the far right, Director Rosenberg. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Director of Public Safety Louis Rosenberg shaking hands with Robert King being held by his father Detective John Henry King, surrounded by Queen Esther on left, William wearing plaid coat, John Jr. wearing leather coat, and Mrs. King second from right, for swearing in ceremony of Detective King, third grade
